tool.name: msp2db
tool.description: - create a msPurity SQLite database from MSP files
tool.command:
#if $input.format == "data_collection" mkdir msp_files && #for $fn in $input.msp_pth #if str( $fn ).endswith(".dat") ln -s '$fn' './msp_files/$fn.name' && #end if #end for #end if
msp2db
#if $input.format == "single_file" --msp_pth "$input.msp_pth" #else --msp_pth "msp_files" #end if
--source $source --out_pth "$out_pth" --db_type sqlite --schema $schema --delete_tables --chunk 200

param.name: source
param.label: Name of spectral library (e.g. MassBank, LocalLibrary, LipidBlast)

data.name: out_pth
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: msPurity database containing library fragmenation spectra

tool.help:
msp2db ==============================
..
----------------
Description -----------
|
Tool to create a SQLite database from a singele or collection of MSP mass spectromertry spectra file(s). The tool is compatible with MSP files formated (schema) as MassBank records or as MoNA records. The resulting SQLite database can be used for msPurity's spectral matching.
Github respository (source code) --------------------------------
https://github.com/computational-metabolomics/msp2db-galaxy/
